New Records: Lautaro Martínez scored twice, extending his streak of goals in consecutive matches; he now has nine goals in Copa América and has scored in his last four games for Argentina
Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored in the 47th and 86th minutes; Peru's goalkeeper saved a penalty by Leandro Paredes
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina had already qualified for the quarterfinals before the match, allowing rest for key players like Lionel Messi; coach Lionel Scaloni was suspended and fined for late second-half starts in previous matches
Post-Match Reflections: Lautaro Martínez reflected on his performance, mentioning his readiness for the tournament and focus on helping the team; Peru was eliminated from the tournament, and Canada qualified as the group runner-up
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami; attendance was 64,972; the game was covered by FS1
